nodes.text: The Spy's Haven was the name given by the explorer Tinrilo x'Rilsam to a small camp established on the Outer Rim planet Tatooine, not far from Mos Eisley, during the Galactic Civil War between the Galactic Empire and the Rebel Alliance. The camp was made of a simple tent that contained an impressive amount of computers and electronic devices. The camp was sudenly abandoned by the time of the Battle of Yavin. A few days later, the camp was found by a band of Jawas as well as by the explorer Tinrilo x'Rilsam. The Jawas immediately started to scavenge the place but they fled when the explorer arrived. Despite his advanced slicing skills, x'Rilsam was unsuccessful with the computers and did not manage to obtain any information. The explorer assumed that Rebel spies were stationed there before run off by the local wild life.

The Spy's Haven was a location in the 2003 video game Star Wars Galaxies, a massively multiplayer online role-playing game developed by Sony Online Entertainment and published by LucasArts, prior to its closure on December 15, 2011. The Spy's Haven was one of many unmarked points of interests on the planet Tatooine. Following the release of the Star Wars Galaxies: Jump to Lightspeed expansion pack in 2004, rare data storage unit devices could sometimes be looted during space battles. One such data storage item, named "an Explorer's Log (1/8)," contained a detailed backstory for the Spy's Haven.
